paper_abstract: The rearrangements for 2-phospha-4-silabicyclo[ 1.1.0] butane, analogous to the valence isomerization of the hydrocarbons bicyclobutane, 1,3-butadiene, and cyclobutene, were studied at the ( U) QCISD( T)/6-311+ G**//(U) QCISD/6-31G* level of theory. The monocyclic 1,2-dihydro-1,2-phosphasiletes are shown to be the thermodynamically preferred product, in contrast to the isomerization of the hydrocarbons, which favors the 1,3-butadiene structure. Furthermore, an unprecedented direct isomerization pathway to the 1,2-dihydro-1,2- phosphasiletes was identified. This pathway is competitive with the isomerization via the open-chain butadienes and becomes favorable when electron-donating substituents are present on silicon.
paper_title: Valence isomerization of 2-phospha-4-silabicyclo[1.1.0]butane: a high-level ab initio study
